body:
Actually, I think this behaviour is expected. If the mode was set to `onChange`, it should also trigger the `onBlur`. 

If this is the case, it’s the other way around.  The controlled component doesn’t trigger the validation if the the input has been focused and blurred without user input.
`onChange` should only trigger validation `onChange`, this is a bug which i will fix for native input.
@bluebill1049 is it possible to use two modes? Like I want to use `onChange` plus `onBlur`?
not at this stage, you will have to attach onBlur (triggerValidation) with onChange
feel free to send a feature request, i can tag it for voting and keep it at the back log in the project.

I have exactly the same issue and made a demo video here:

https://app.usebubbles.com/e502420e-c5bb-4106-b55d-1dfd316b7e69

@bluebill1049 thanks for the fix but do you know how to install this? I tried:

```
yarn add 'git+ssh://git@github.com:react-hook-form/react-hook-form.git#d3bcfcb44cce770badf2780f83786d3a678b4ec1'
```

but Typescript cannot find the package: `Cannot find module 'react-hook-form'.ts(2307)`
I will re-open this issue so i remind myself to publish a beta version.
@bluebill1049 I saw you released this already on 5.1.1 right?
no, not really. i will have to release a beta version for this.
